result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Khalar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($343) and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Domestic Violence or Anger Mangement Counseling and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint and with her permission and Agent's approval.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - To be used at Agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes: Court costs have been converted to a civil judgment.

Huber with standard release conditions, commencing forthwith.
Apply 30 days sentence credit.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert J. Khalar in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.    

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
75 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
30 Days Credit.
Defendant can be transferred to Huber - FORTHWITH.

Any outstanding financial obligations can be convert to a civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-05-2016 11:00 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-11-2016 02:45 pm

Received and filed in court by the State.

Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert J. Khalar in court. 

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.
Victim presented a statement to the court.




Court orders the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Domestic Violence or Anger Management Counseling and follow through if agent deems appropriate.  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint and with her permission and agents approval.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
D.V. Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert J. Khalar in court.  

Defendant wants time to retain an attorney.
Defendant also referred to the Public Defender's Office.

  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
filed by victim requesting the no contact order be lifted.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or her residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. He may get his belongings only with a officer present.
